intro: Lippia bradei, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. Lippia bradei is also valued as a source of essential oils due to its strong, distinctive scent.
